title: Airy huge Studio - 300+ SF
map_address: Calumet St near St. Alphonsus St
posting_body: APARTMENT DESCRIPTION:
Huge airy Studio with private bathroom (full tub), two windows.
Building is split-level style built into a slope so the back and side walls are not underground at all
Kitchen and laundry is shared with 3 other tenants -see floorplan diagram
Room is 13 foot 9 inches by 13 foot 4 inches - big enough to fit queen size bed, desk, TV console, and couch!
Big enough for separate zones for office/work from home, and even doing yoga/exercise.
Room can be provided furnished or unfurnished.
Separate private entrance for you
TO APPLY:
Please email back at the link and state your CELL PHONE NUMBER for fastest response.
ABOUT THE NEIGHBORHOOD:
Tight-knit yet diverse, Mission Hill located in Suffolk County stands as one of the best places to live.

Mission Hill is a great place to live, not solely for its proximity to the Longwood Medical Area and public transportation, or its scenery with views of Boston from several spots, including the Mission Hill Playground, but because of the atmosphere of the neighborhood.
Location Overview:
Median home price: $640,000
Average rent price for a one-bedroom: $1,890 per month
Transit options:
Green line: Huntington Ave and Mission Park Dr, Boston, MA 02115 (9 min walk)
39 bus from Huntington Ave @ Parker Hill Ave
The Roxbury Crossing stop on the Orange Line located on Tremont Street in Mission Hill
Grocery stores: Stop & Shop Brigham Circle 1620
Tremont St.
Mission Hill’s food scene:  Chilacates, Solid Ground Cafe, and Laughing Monk Cafe.
Places to exercise: Mission Hill Yoga and TrillFit’s cardio dance studio.
Parker Hill branch of the Boston Public Library located in Mission Hill.
With the perfect amount of city life, scenery, and proximity, Mission Hill stands as one of the best living spots in the Greater Boston Area.
